concept_data.title: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions

summary: The "International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions" (IFLA) is a prominent non-governmental organisation (NGO) that plays a crucial role in the global library and information sector. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, IFLA advocates for the advancement of library services and the promotion of information access as a fundamental right. The organisation collaborates with EU institutions to influence policies that affect libraries, ensuring that they remain integral to cultural heritage and education. As a redirect to the preferred term "IFLA," this concept underscores the federation's significance in shaping library-related legislation and fostering international cooperation among library professionals.
